captions.text: I can't believe this is my last week at Bucheon High School.
It's been over three years now and time has seriously flown by.
I can absolutely remember the first day I came here:
Even though I was from Canada, I was a bit of a weigookin (foreigner),
You guys welcomed me with totally open arms.
Every time I see you guys you always say hi to me,
and make me feel happy and warm on the inside,
so thank you so much.  I will never, ever forget you guys.
I wanted to put together a video for you to show
how much I care about you and how much I love you guys
and how warm you make me feel, so I hope you guys enjoy the video,
and I will really, seriously miss you guys.

title: Martina's Goodbye Video to her High School

comments.text:
Martina, I'm in college, and I met one of your students! It was really cool 
to have an interaction between a Nasty (myself) and someone that sees 
Martina as only a teacher. I heard some fun stories, too! *rasies eyebrows* 
I am sure that one day you will go back to teaching. I believe that there 
are at least 4 or 5 careers that perfectly suit a person. I really love 
what you do at EYK, but I don't see that as the only thing you'd be amazing 
at. To the future! *clinks shot glass*

comments.text:
Aside from the long hours and crazy stress of preparing for the Korean 
SATs, Korean schools look MUCH better than my school. .-. I love the school 
spirit, the festivals and other events, etc. I'm not saying all schools are 
like that, but at least this school looks better than mine. D:
comments.author: ForeverCellist

comments.text:
Yeah, it was Simon who had the negative experience. Basically, his school 
didn't include him in anything or really even tell him much, and he just 
wasn't really treated like part of the school (unlike Martina; she said her 
school was great to her). Simon's school also wouldn't let him teach the 
way he wanted to teach and tried to force him to teach by some dumb 
textbook/audio program, but he wanted to make learning English an enjoyable 
experience. Eventually he just couldn't put up with it.
